title.narrative: Mechanism 17958 - Afyainfo National Mechanism Follow on (HIGDA)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
Improve organizational, institutional and leadership capability of MOH DivHISM&E Unit to manage National Integrated Health Management Information System.
"Support National HISICC to i) manage national HIS/ICT strategies, policy and or guidelines development processes, ii)ccordinate development of procurement policy and implementation plan that ensures that host country and development partners' n Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. objectives

Improve organizational, institutional and leadership capability of MOH DivHISM&E Unit to manage National Integrated Health Management Information System.
"Support National HISICC to i) manage national HIS/ICT strategies, policy and or guidelines development processes, ii)ccordinate development of procurement policy and implementation plan that ensures that host country and development partners' needs are aligned to the extent possible so that technology investments in the health sector especially for National HIV response is supported with a cohesive strategy
"
Support MOH DivHISME to i)ensure application of consistent systems' interoperability rules across all technical domains, ii)to develop and enforce use of nationally agreed terminology and unified indicator sets to achieve semantic interoperability between systems, and iii) to identify and agree upon core or minimum data sets that would ensure that essential HIV prevention, care and treatment data are captured by different partners in different settings in a comparable and consistent manner, allowing for analysis at higher levels.
Support MOH to i) develop and maintain foundational Health Information Exchange (HIE) infrastructure components such as client, health worker, and facilities registries; agreed upon terminology services and shared health records, ii) to proactively address patient privacy, security, sensitive data, consent, and data access structures, and iii) to develop its HIE organizational capacity with skilled people, mature processes, sustainable technology, and reliable resource stream.
Coordinate PEPFAR IPs to meet S/APR reporting requirements through DHIS2/DATIM:- i) Hold meetings to update PEPFAR implementing partner

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
